intro: Sloanea longiseta, commonly known as the long-hairy sloanea, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Sloanea longiseta produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
